title: Crossing & Closing the Digital Divide

extendedProps.description: Join Ron Guerrier for a solo presentation tracing their remarkable career journey through the ever-changing world of technology. From starting as a PC support rep to becoming a 5X CIO, advising a Governor, and serving as a Fortune 500 Board Director,  Ron Guerrier shares invaluable insights into tech's evolution, personal lessons learned, and advice for minorities to thrive in STEM. Gain insights into tech's evolution, leadership lessons, and actionable strategies to bridge the digital divide and excel in STEM. A must-attend event for tech professionals, aspiring STEM enthusiasts, and anyone interested in shaping the future of technology and diversity.Access to the Executive Stage requires an Executive or All Access Badge. title: The Entrepreneur’s Journey: From Startup to Acquisition | Presented by AMEX

extendedProps.description: From the innate drive to succeed against all odds to the struggle to maintain your identity in a homogeneous environment, the journey of a startup company on its path to acquisition (and beyond) is very familiar to most black technology professionals. Understanding the synergy between these two experiences and the lessons learned from industry pioneers who have navigated both journeys can provide a competitive advantage for any black tech innovator looking to succeed in the world of startups, venture capital, or mergers and acquisitions. Senior executives from American Express with personal experiences in all phases of the journey from the startup and VC ecosystem to a large corporate enterprise will share their stories, best practices, and actionable steps to success.Tony JacksonChief Technology Officer - Resy, American Express Global DiningGary KenseySenior Vice President and Unit CIO for Global Services Group & Corporate Technology - American ExpressOpe RunseweHead of Business Development - American Express Ventures

title: SPILLing the Tea: Centering Culture Creators with Co-Founder Phonz

extendedProps.description: If the emergence of Black-owned music labels changed the game for hip hop, SPILL, the next Black-owned social media app, will do the same for social. The visual conversation app that is the de facto place to discuss and discover culture aspires to be the first unicorn Black-owned social media app. Utilizing large language model AI and new technology, Spill aims to recognize and reward the culture drivers, often the marginalized voices that determine a platform’s relevance early on, to create a thriving creator and advertiser ecosystem. extendedProps.description:
Liberia won the Jollof Tastings at Afrotech in 2022, but Ghana,, Nigeria, Senegal and Sierraleone claim it was a daylight robbery! Revenge is on the mind of West African countries competing in this year's edition of the Jollof Festival @"AFROTECH™ Who will win the Jollof Rice contest Afrotech 2023?!

Jollof rice is a one-pot rice dish native to many countries in West Africa. Some consider it the predecessor to the cajun dish, jambalaya.

The experience of the Jollof Festival focuses on the pride West Africans exude in their native dishes, and a  condensed version of the experience will be present at Afrotech 2023!

Festival participants not only get to enjoy these foods, but get to interact with the festival itself by voting to determine the winner of the “Jollof Wars,” a head-to-head battle that pits one representative from each country against each other for the title of Best Jollof Rice.

Sample Jollof Rice dishes in a festive blind-tasting, and vote for the best one at the Jollof Festival Afrotech!

title: Health Summit | Music as the Cultural Connector in Reducing Healthcare Disparities  | Presented by Bayer

extendedProps.description: Music has the power to move us unlike words alone. It connects with us, moves us to act, and as you may be surprised to hear, it has the power to improve health and nutrition in our communities.  In this panel. Bayer, one of the world’s leading companies in the fields of health and nutrition, will shed light on self-care and America’s growing needs, the disparities in black communities, and the role music and technology can play as catalysts for positive change.  To enrich this discussion and show the importance of coming together as a one tech and music community, Bayer leadership will be joined by world renowned entertainer and founder of Hip Hop Public Health, Doug E. Fresh, and Head of Pharmaceuticals for Google, Yvette Baez.  The discussion will focus on music, data, technology, and the legacy these organizations seek to leave with the black community and generations to come.    Access to the Summit Stage requires a Corporate, Executive or All Access Badge. Secure or upgrade your ticket today!Doug E.
